intro: Scrophularia lepidota, commonly known as the woolly betony, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Scrophularia lepidota is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
